CSSMin-block-size.summary: The min-block-size CSS property defines the minimum horizontal or vertical size of an element's block, depending on its writing mode. It corresponds to either the min-width or the min-height property, depending on the value of writing-mode.

remarks.para: If the writing mode is vertically oriented, the value of min-block-size relates to the minimum width of the element; otherwise, it relates to the minimum height of the element. A related property is min-inline-size, which defines the other dimension of the element.

-The mapped physical properties: min-width and min-height
-writing-mode

CSSMin-block-size.value: The min-block-size property takes the same values as the min-width and min-height properties.
